item.title: AI生成假新闻图片引争议，风投公司宣传配图被指张冠李戴
item.description:
长话短说：有评论指出，某知名风投公司在宣传其新150亿美元基金时，配图使用了AI生成的假新闻图片，引发争议。该图片与文章主题不符，被质疑为张冠李戴，反映了该公司近年来的品牌设计选择问题。

  1. 评论者指出，风投公司在强调美国重要性的博客文章中，配图却使用了珠穆朗玛峰的图片。
  2. 该图片被证实为AI生成，属于假新闻图片。
  3. 这一选择被视为该公司近年来品牌视觉设计决策的典型体现。

来源：相关推文、xgo.ing

item.title: 是时候开始建设了。 / It’s time to build.
item.description:
是时候开始建设了。a16z @a16z 在安德森·霍洛维茨（Andreessen Horowitz），我们刚刚筹集了超过150亿美元。这些新资金包括美国活力基金（11.76亿美元）、应用基金（17亿美元）、生物与健康基金（7亿美元）、基础设施基金（17亿美元）、增长基金（67.5亿美元）以及其他风险投资策略（30亿美元），我们筹集了2025年美国所有风险投资资金的18%以上。我们为什么筹集这些资金，以及我们计划如何投资？阅读本·霍洛维茨（Ben Horowitz）的更多内容：a16z.news/p/we-raised-15… 🔗 查看引用推文 💬 193 🔄 124 ❤️ 1895 👀 204288 📊 250 ⚡ 由 xgo.ing 提供支持 --- Original: It’s time to build. a16z @a16z At Andreessen Horowitz, we just raised over $15B. With these new funds including American Dynamism ($1.176B), Apps ($1.7B), Bio + Health ($700M), Infrastructure ($1.7B), Growth ($6.75B), and other venture strategies ($3B), we raised over 18% of all venture capital dollars allocated in the United States in 2025. Why did we raise the money and how do we plan to invest it? Read more from Ben Horowitz: a16z.news/p/we-raised-15… 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 193 🔄 124 ❤️ 1895 👀 204288 📊 250 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing

If you’re up for a huge challenge, join 1,000 of the country’s best and brightest technologists in the inaugural class of @USTechForce . We are partnering with the top U.S. technology companies to take on this challenge. You’ll learn a ton, network across the most important government agencies and private sector companies, ultimately creating powerful career opportunities whether you want to continue in public service or join the private sector. I am grateful to @POTUS for ensuring that America remains the world’s technology leader. G…

item.title: 是时候赢得AI之战了。🇺🇸 / It's time to win AI. 🇺🇸
item.description:
是时候赢得AI之战了。🇺🇸 David Sacks（@davidsacks47）今天，特朗普总统签署了一项关于“确保人工智能国家政策框架”的行政命令。该命令宣布，美国必须为AI制定一个“负担最小的国家标准”，而不是“50个各自为政的州级标准”。政府将与国会合作确定这一标准。目标是避免混乱的监管拼凑，同时保护儿童安全等重要价值观。这项命令本身并非框架，也不是赦免或暂停令，而是一套原则声明和工具集，供政府用于抵制各州最繁重和过度的AI法律。 --- Original: It's time to win AI. 🇺🇸 David Sacks @davidsacks47 Today President Trump signed an Executive Order on “Ensuring a National Policy Framework for Artificial Intelligence.” This Order declares that the United States must have one “minimally burdensome national standard” for AI, not “50 discordant state ones.” The Administration will work with Congress to define that standard. The objective is to prevent a confusing regulatory patchwork, while protecting important values like child safety. This Order is not that framework itself, or an amnesty or moratorium, but rather a statement of principles and a set of tools for the Administration to push back on the most onerous and excessive State AI laws.…

item.title: 是时候打造美国自己的AI了 / It’s time to build American AI.
item.description:
是时候打造美国自己的AI了。Collin McCune @Collin_McCune 这项行政命令是至关重要的第一步——感谢@POTUS、@DavidSacks、@mkratsios47和@sriramk的领导。但联邦层面的人工智能立法仍处于真空状态。国会需要团结起来，制定一套明确的规则，以保护数百万使用AI的美国民众，以及推动AI发展的中小型科技创业者。我们@a16z坚信，建立一个支持创新、促进竞争、保护消费者的联邦框架，不仅是可能的，更是美国保持对中国领先优势的关键。各州在应对危害和保护民众方面扮演重要角色，但它们无法提供长远的明确性或国家层面的指导…… --- Original: It’s time to build American AI. Collin McCune @Collin_McCune The EO is an incredibly important first step – and thank you to @POTUS , @DavidSacks , @mkratsios47 , and @sriramk for their leadership. But the vacuum for federal AI legislation remains. Congress needs to come together to create a clear set of rules that protect the millions of Americans using AI and the Little Tech builders driving it forward. We @a16z firmly believe a pro-innovation, pro-competition, and pro-consumer federal framework is both possible and essential to keep America ahead of China. States have an important role in addressing harms and protecting people, but they can’t provide the long-term clarity or national dire…

item.content:encoded:
是时候打造美国自己的AI了。Collin McCune @Collin_McCune 这项行政命令是至关重要的第一步——感谢@POTUS、@DavidSacks、@mkratsios47和@sriramk的领导。但联邦层面的人工智能立法仍处于真空状态。国会需要团结起来，制定一套明确的规则，以保护数百万使用AI的美国民众，以及推动AI发展的中小型科技创业者。我们@a16z坚信，建立一个支持创新、促进竞争、保护消费者的联邦框架，不仅是可能的，更是美国保持对中国领先优势的关键。各州在应对危害和保护民众方面扮演重要角色，但它们无法提供长远的明确性或国家层面的指导…… --- Original: It’s time to build American AI. Collin McCune @Collin_McCune The EO is an incredibly important first step – and thank you to @POTUS , @DavidSacks , @mkratsios47 , and @sriramk for their leadership. But the vacuum for federal AI legislation remains. Congress needs to come together to create a clear set of rules that protect the millions of Americans using AI and the Little Tech builders driving it forward. We @a16z firmly believe a pro-innovation, pro-competition, and pro-consumer federal framework is both possible and essential to keep America ahead of China. States have an important role in addressing harms and protecting people, but they can’t provide the long-term clarity or national dire…

item.description:
🎯 大卫·萨克斯（David Sacks）@DavidSacks 上个月，一堆危言耸听的标题声称AI正在对美国就业造成“严重破坏”。这基于追踪已公布裁员情况的十月挑战者格雷（Challenger Gray）报告。这些标题具有误导性或完全错误。十一月的挑战者格雷报告明确指出：1. 十月的激增是异常情况。十一月下降了53%。2. 十一月公布的裁员中，仅有6,280例可归因于AI。3. 截至今年，AI仅占总裁员数的4.7%（且这个数字可能偏高，因为是自报数据——CEO们宁愿归咎于AI，也不愿承认自己的工作表现）。无论你认为AI未来会如何，它目前并非主要原因…… --- Original: 🎯 David Sacks @DavidSacks Last month, a bunch of scare headlines claimed that AI was “wreaking havoc” on U.S. jobs. This was based on October’s Challenger Gray report, which tracks announced layoffs. These headlines were misleading or outright false. November’s Challenger Gray report makes clear that: 1. The October spike was anomalous. November fell by 53%. 2. Only 6,280 layoffs announced in November were attributable to AI. 3. For the year to date, AI has accounted for only 4.7% of total layoffs (and this number is likely high since it’s self-reported — CEOs would rather blame AI than their own job performance.) Regardless of what you believe AI will do in the future, it is not a major cau…

item.description:
💯 Peter Hague @peterrhague 乐观者和悲观者在一定程度上都有道理。我反复思考的是这张图表。西方社会在关键商品和服务的供应上严重搞砸了，同时却创造了技术上的丰饶。关键在于让红色部分的表现更像蓝色部分。这既是技术问题，也是政治问题。🔗 查看引用推文 💬 77 🔄 113 ❤️ 1475 👀 388299 📊 209 ⚡ 由 xgo.ing 驱动 --- Original: 💯 Peter Hague @peterrhague The optimists and pessimists both have a point, to an extent. What I keep coming back to is this chart. Western societies have profoundly buggered up the supply of critical goods and services, whilst at the same time producing a technological cornucopia. Trick is to make the red stuff behave more like the blue stuff. This is both a technological and a political problem. 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 77 🔄 113 ❤️ 1475 👀 388299 📊 209 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing

What I keep coming back to is this chart. Western societies have profoundly buggered up the supply of critical goods and services, whilst at the same time producing a technological cornucopia. Trick is to make the red stuff behave more like the blue stuff. This is both a technological and a political problem. 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 77 🔄 113 ❤️ 1475 👀 388299 📊 209 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing

item.title: 超越竞争、超越创新、超越制造。🇺🇸 / Out-compete, out-innovate, and out-manufacture. 🇺🇸
item.description:
超越竞争、超越创新、超越制造。🇺🇸 战争部副部长埃米尔·迈克尔（Emil Michael）@USWREMichael 表示，赫格塞斯部长（Secretary Hegseth）说得对——我们必须紧急行动，扩大已验证且成本效益高的技术规模。我们的作战人员应始终在战场上拥有不公平的优势。@SecWar 表示：“我们必须超越对手的竞争、创新和制造能力。” 🔗 查看引用推文 💬 71 🔄 138 ❤️ 2745 👀 199273 📊 230 ⚡ 由 xgo.ing 提供支持 --- Original: Out-compete, out-innovate, and out-manufacture. 🇺🇸 Under Secretary of War Emil Michael @USWREMichael Secretary Hegseth is spot on — we must act with urgency to scale proven, cost-effective technologies. Our warfighters should always have an unfair advantage on the battlefield. @SecWar : “We must out-compete, out-innovate, and out-manufacture our opponents.” 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 71 🔄 138 ❤️ 2745 👀 199273 📊 230 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing

item.title: 是时候建设了。 / It’s time to build.
item.description:
是时候建设了。美国副国务卿雅各布·S·赫尔伯格（Jacob S. Helberg）@UnderSecE 表示，美国新的国家安全战略指出：“正如亚历山大·汉密尔顿（Alexander Hamilton）在我国建国初期所主张的，美国绝不能依赖任何外部势力来获取国防或经济所需的核心组件——从原材料到零部件再到成品。……未来属于创造者。”阅读完整战略。👇 whitehouse.gov/wp-content/upl… s 🔗 查看引用推文 💬 141 🔄 276 ❤️ 4120 👀 592037 📊 411 ⚡ 由 xgo.ing 提供支持 --- Original: It’s time to build. Under Secretary of State Jacob S. Helberg @UnderSecE The new National Security Strategy of the United States: "As Alexander Hamilton argued in our republic’s earliest days, the United States must never be dependent on any outside power for core components—from raw materials to parts to finished products— necessary to the nation’s defense or economy. ...The future belongs to makers.” Read the full strategy.👇 whitehouse.gov/wp-content/upl… s 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 141 🔄 276 ❤️ 4120 👀 592037 📊 411 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing

item.title: 是时候开始建设了。 / IT’S TIME TO BUILD.
item.description:
是时候开始建设了。Jan Sramek 🇺🇲 🌁 ⛰️ @jansramek 1/ 住房是当今时代的关键议题。随着加州平均房价逼近100万美元，美国顶尖城市经济学家@CSElmendorf和Ed Glaeser呼吁加州停止否决政治，开始建设。更多。住房。🇺🇸 来自今日@latimes：🔗 查看引用推文 💬 94 🔄 62 ❤️ 1238 👀 135110 📊 147 ⚡ 由xgo.ing驱动 --- Original: IT’S TIME TO BUILD. Jan Sramek 🇺🇲 🌁 ⛰️ @jansramek 1/ Housing is the defining issue of our time. As California's average home prices approach $1 million, @CSElmendorf and Ed Glaeser, America's leading urban economists, call on California to stop the vetocracy and BUILD. MORE. HOMES. 🇺🇸 From today's @latimes : 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 94 🔄 62 ❤️ 1238 👀 135110 📊 147 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing

item.title: 来自@HHS_Jim及其同事改善美国人生活的非凡愿景与雄心。是时候构建健康AI了。🩺👨‍⚕️🇺🇸🚀 / Truly incredible vision and ambition to improve American lives from @HHS_Jim and his colleagues. It’...
item.description:
来自@HHS_Jim及其同事改善美国人生活的非凡愿景与雄心。是时候构建健康AI了。🩺👨‍⚕️🇺🇸🚀 副部长吉姆·奥尼尔（Jim O'Neill）@HHS_Jim 我们很高兴发布我们的AI战略，通过现代化流程、减少繁文缛节，并将实用工具交到员工手中，以推动HHS（美国卫生与公众服务部）快速采用AI。未来，AI将帮助我们加速FDA（美国食品药品监督管理局）的审批流程，在CMS（美国医疗保险和医疗补助服务中心）打击欺诈并改进理赔裁决，并简化整个部门的拨款审查。该战略为HHS在推动医疗保健行业AI应用中的作用奠定了基础。我感谢我的同事们开启AI新篇章，以支持更健康的美国... --- Original: Truly incredible vision and ambition to improve American lives from @HHS_Jim and his colleagues. It’s time to build health AI. 🩺👨‍⚕️🇺🇸🚀 Deputy Secretary Jim O'Neill @HHS_Jim We are excited to release our AI Strategy to advance rapid AI adoption across HHS by modernizing processes, cutting red tape, and getting usable tools into the hands of our workforce. In the future, AI will help us accelerate approvals at FDA, fight fraud and improve claim adjudication at CMS, and streamline grant review across the department. The Strategy lays the foundation for HHS' role in advancing AI across the health care industry. I thank my colleagues for ushing in the next chapter of AI to support a healthier Am…

item.title: 这就是我们的道路。🇺🇸 / This is the way. 🇺🇸
item.description:
这就是我们的道路。🇺🇸 帕尔默·拉奇（Palmer Luckey）@PalmerLuckey 我们不会改变，也不会放慢脚步。这正是他们希望我们做的，也正是竞争对手所期望的，而这与打造安全、强大、高性价比武器的实际做法背道而驰。🔗 查看引用推文 💬 86 🔄 176 ❤️ 4455 👀 416593 📊 344 ⚡ 由 xgo.ing 提供支持 --- Original: This is the way. 🇺🇸 Palmer Luckey @PalmerLuckey We aren't going to change. We aren't going to slow down. That is exactly what they want us to do, exactly what our competitors want, and the opposite of what building safe, powerful, cost-effecfive weapons actually looks like. 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 86 🔄 176 ❤️ 4455 👀 416593 📊 344 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing

item.title: 历经数十载，大规模预测市场之梦终成真，助不完美的我们洞察未来 / The multi decade dream of a high scale prediction market that helps our imperfect selves discern the...
item.description:
那个帮助我们这些不完美之人洞察未来的大规模预测市场，历经数十年的梦想终于实现。Tarek Mansour（@mansourtarek_）创立的Kalshi以110亿美元估值融资10亿美元。十年前，仅数千人了解预测市场为何物。十八个月前，多数预测市场仍被禁——直到我们突破政府限制，将其解放。过去七年，我们的社群开创了一个全新领域。如今，Kalshi已赢得数百万人的信任、使用与喜爱。它已成为日常文化的一部分，并推动着近期消费行为中最重大的转变之一。预测市场的时代终于来临…… --- Original: The multi decade dream of a high scale prediction market that helps our imperfect selves discern the future has finally arrived. Tarek Mansour @mansourtarek_ Kalshi raised $1B at an $11B valuation. A decade ago, only a few thousand people knew what a prediction market was. Eighteen months ago, most prediction markets were banned - until we overcame the government to set them free. Over the past seven years, our community has opened up an entirely new category. Today, Kalshi is trusted, used, and loved by millions of people. It’s a part of everyday culture, and it’s driving one of the most important shifts in consumer behavior in recent history. The time has finally come for prediction market…

item.title: 完全正确。🇺🇸🚀 / Exactly right. 🇺🇸🚀
item.description:
完全正确。🇺🇸🚀 Ryan Shea（@ryaneshea）让我花一分钟谈谈大卫·萨克斯（David Sacks）的成就，因为许多人（尤其是《纽约时报》）并未充分认识到他作为美国人工智能与加密货币事务主管所带来的巨大影响力、变革力与公正性……简而言之，大卫·萨克斯是美国创新力的倍增器。以下仅列举他自2025年1月20日就职以来，与特朗普总统及同事们共同取得的部分成就：第14170号行政命令：消除美国在人工智能领域的领导障碍 - 2025年1月23日 - 加速数据中心建设与人工智能系统出口 - 已推动工资增长25-30%…… --- Original: Exactly right. 🇺🇸🚀 Ryan Shea @ryaneshea Let me blow your mind on David Sacks’ accomplishments for a minute, because many (the NYT in particular) are not appreciating just how impactful, transformative and impartial he has been as the AI and Crypto Czar of the United States... Simply put, David Sacks is a force multiplier for American innovation. Here is just a short list of David Sacks’ many accomplishments alongside President Trump and colleagues since taking office on January 20, 2025: Executive Order 14170: Removing Barriers to American Leadership in Artificial Intelligence - January 23, 2025 - Expedited data center construction and AI system exports - Led to wage increases of 25-30% for…

item.title: 关于DOGE（政府效率部）已死的报道纯属夸大其词。🇺🇸🚀 / Reports of DOGE's death have been greatly exaggerated. 🇺🇸🚀
item.description:
关于DOGE（政府效率部）已死的报道纯属夸大其词。🇺🇸🚀 政府效率部 @DOGE 一如既往，这是来自@路透社的假新闻。特朗普总统受美国人民委托，致力于推动联邦政府现代化，减少浪费、欺诈和滥用职权。就在上周，DOGE（政府效率部）终止了78份浪费性合同，为纳税人节省了3.35亿美元。我们将在几天后恢复每周五的定期更新。🇺🇸 🔗 查看引用推文 💬 112 🔄 158 ❤️ 3679 👀 264205 📊 306 ⚡ 由 xgo.ing 提供支持 --- Original: Reports of DOGE's death have been greatly exaggerated. 🇺🇸🚀 Department of Government Efficiency @DOGE As usual, this is fake news from @Reuters . President Trump was given a mandate by the American people to modernize the federal government and reduce waste, fraud and abuse. Just last week, DOGE terminated 78 wasteful contracts and saved taxpayers $335M. We’ll be back in a few days with our regularly scheduled Friday update. 🇺🇸 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 112 🔄 158 ❤️ 3679 👀 264205 📊 306 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing

item.title: 自我推荐！ / Self-recommending!
item.description:
自我推荐！帕特里克·奥肖内西（Patrick OShaughnessy，@patrick_oshag）与沃尔夫冈·哈默（Wolfgang Hammer）对话，后者帮助初创企业和财富100强公司的创始人及CEO们运用叙事技巧，更好地理解他们所做的事情及其意义。这次对话在许多方面堪称一本手册，教你如何找到自己的故事，并以引发共鸣的方式传达它。沃尔夫冈（@Beuysaunt）是一位电影制片人和高管，曾参与创作《纸牌屋》（House of Cards）并管理过几家大型制片厂。目前，他在米奇·拉斯基（Mitch Lasky）和马克·安德森（Marc Andreessen）的支持下，正在打造一种新型的电影制片厂。我们探讨了故事如何发挥作用、优秀故事的共同点，以及理解自身故事为何能带来变革性影响。沃尔夫冈解释了…… --- Original: Self-recommending! Patrick OShaughnessy @patrick_oshag Wolfgang Hammer helps founders and CEOs, at both startups and massive fortune 100 companies, use storytelling to better understand what they do, and why it matters. In many ways, this conversation is a manual for how to find that story and communicate it in a way that resonates. Wolfgang ( @Beuysaunt ) is a film producer and executive who helped create House of Cards and ran several major studios. He’s now building a new kind of film studio with support from Mitch Lasky and Marc Andreessen. We talk about how stories work, what great ones have in common, and why understanding your own story can be transformative. Wolfgang explains the thr…

自我推荐！帕特里克·奥肖内西（Patrick OShaughnessy，@patrick_oshag）与沃尔夫冈·哈默（Wolfgang Hammer）对话，后者帮助初创企业和财富100强公司的创始人及CEO们运用叙事技巧，更好地理解他们所做的事情及其意义。这次对话在许多方面堪称一本手册，教你如何找到自己的故事，并以引发共鸣的方式传达它。沃尔夫冈（@Beuysaunt）是一位电影制片人和高管，曾参与创作《纸牌屋》（House of Cards）并管理过几家大型制片厂。目前，他在米奇·拉斯基（Mitch Lasky）和马克·安德森（Marc Andreessen）的支持下，正在打造一种新型的电影制片厂。我们探讨了故事如何发挥作用、优秀故事的共同点，以及理解自身故事为何能带来变革性影响。沃尔夫冈解释了…… --- Original: Self-recommending! Patrick OShaughnessy @patrick_oshag Wolfgang Hammer helps founders and CEOs, at both startups and massive fortune 100 companies, use storytelling to better understand what they do, and why it matters. In many ways, this conversation is a manual for how to find that story and communicate it in a way that resonates. Wolfgang ( @Beuysaunt ) is a film producer and executive who helped create House of Cards and ran several major studios. He’s now building a new kind of film studio with support from Mitch Lasky and Marc Andreessen. We talk about how stories work, what great ones have in common, and why understanding your own story can be transformative. Wolfgang explains the thr…

🎯🚀 Yatharth @yatharthmaan：“埃隆·马斯克不是工程师。”约翰·卡马克：埃隆绝对是工程师。他深度参与SpaceX和特斯拉的技术决策。他现在不写代码或做CAD，但他完全有能力这么做。罗伯特·祖布林：我见到埃隆时，很明显他虽然具备科学思维、理解科学原理，但对火箭一无所知。一点都没有。那是2001年，到了2007年，他掌握了关于火箭的一切——他真的什么都懂，非常详细。你必须投入大量学习，才能达到他现在对火箭的了解程度。这不仅仅是和人们混在一起就能获得的。埃里克·伯杰：埃隆是那个…… --- Original: 🎯🚀 Yatharth @yatharthmaan "Elon Musk is not an engineer." John Carmack: Elon is definitely an engineer. He is deeply involved with technical decisions at SpaceX and Tesla. He doesn’t write code or do CAD today, but he is perfectly capable of doing so. Robert Zubrin: When I met Elon it was apparent to me that although he had a scientific mind and he understood scientific principles, he did not know anything about rockets. Nothing. That was in 2001, by 2007 he knew everything about rockets – he really knew everything, in detail. You have to put some serious study in to know as much about rockets as he knows now. This doesn't come just from hanging out with people. Eric Berger: Elon is the chie…

item.description:
🎯 大卫·萨克斯（David Sacks）@DavidSacks 表示，若以消费者采用度衡量，AI聊天机器人是有史以来最受欢迎的技术；但若以民意调查数据评判，它们却最不受欢迎。这该如何解释？很大程度上要归因于“末日产业复合体”——数百个受资助的组织散布关于AI的末日论调。作家尼里特·韦斯-布拉特（Nirit Weiss-Blatt, @DrTechlash）分析了这一生态系统，发现其资金仅来源于少数几位有效利他主义亿万富翁，即达斯汀·莫斯科维茨（Dustin Moskovitz）、詹·塔林（Jaan Tallinn）、维塔利克·布特林（Vitalik Buterin）和萨姆·班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried，是的，就是那位已定罪的罪犯）。他们共同为渲染AI灾难的事业捐赠了超过十亿美元。那些重复此类论调的人应当…… --- Original: 🎯 David Sacks @DavidSacks If judged based on consumer adoption, AI chatbots are the most popular technology ever. If judged based on poll numbers, they are the least popular. How to explain this? A big part of it is the Doomer Industrial Complex — hundreds of astroturfed organizations that have spread doomer narratives about AI. Writer Nirit Weiss-Blatt ( @DrTechlash ) has analyzed this ecosystem and traced its funding to just a few Effective Altruism billionaires. Namely Dustin Moskovitz, Jaan Tallinn, Vitalik Buterin, and Sam Bankman-Fried (yes, the convicted felon). Collectively they have donated over a billion dollars to the cause of catastrophizing AI. Those repeating the memes should u…

item.description:
Variety（@Variety）在#Pluribus的演职员表中隐藏了一行字：“本节目由人类制作。”创作者文斯·吉利根（Vince Gilligan）笑着告诉Variety：“我讨厌AI。AI是世界上最昂贵、最耗能的剽窃机器。我觉得这很可能全是胡扯。基本上就是一群身家千亿的富豪，他们的人生最大目标是成为世界首批万亿富翁。我认为他们只是在兜售一堆虚无缥缈的东西。”阅读@ethanshanfeld的完整“Pluribus”报道：wp.me/pc8uak-1lGwMi 🔗 查看引用推文 💬 80 🔄 36 ❤️ 1620 👀 291503 📊 153 ⚡ 由xgo.ing提供支持 --- Original: Variety @Variety Tucked away in the #Pluribus credits, it reads, “This show was made by humans.” “I hate AI,” creator Vince Gilligan told Variety with a chuckle. “AI is the world’s most expensive and energy-intensive plagiarism machine. I think there’s a very high possibility that this is all a bunch of horseshit. It’s basically a bunch of centibillionaires whose greatest life goal is to become the world’s first trillionaires. I think they’re selling a bag of vapor.” Read the full “Pluribus” story from @ethanshanfeld here: wp.me/pc8uak-1lGwMi 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 80 🔄 36 ❤️ 1620 👀 291503 📊 153 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing

item.title: 推文 / Tweet
item.description:
教宗利奥十四世（Pope Leo XIV）@Pontifex 表示：技术创新可以成为参与神圣创造行为的一种形式。它承载着伦理与精神上的重量，因为每一个设计选择都表达了对人性的某种愿景。因此，教会呼吁所有#AI（人工智能）的构建者，将道德辨别力培养为工作的基本组成部分——开发出能体现正义、团结以及对生命真正尊重的系统。🔗 查看引用推文 💬 216 🔄 100 ❤️ 2912 👀 534355 📊 338 ⚡ 由 xgo.ing 驱动 --- Original: Pope Leo XIV @Pontifex Technological innovation can be a form of participation in the divine act of creation. It carries an ethical and spiritual weight, for every design choice expresses a vision of humanity. The Church therefore calls all builders of #AI to cultivate moral discernment as a fundamental part of their work—to develop systems that reflect justice, solidarity, and a genuine reverence for life. 🔗 View Quoted Tweet 💬 216 🔄 100 ❤️ 2912 👀 534355 📊 338 ⚡ Powered by xgo.ing
